context: The Estonian word 'keegi' is an indefinite pronoun used to refer to an unspecified or unknown person. It can mean 'someone' or 'somebody' in English. In affirmative sentences, it indicates an unidentified person (e.g., 'Someone knocked'). In negative sentences with 'mitte', it means 'no one' (e.g., '(Not) no one came to help'). The word has various case forms like genitive 'kellegi', partitive 'kedagi', etc. depending on its grammatical function in the sentence.
